result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
During the pendency of this deferral, the Defendant agrees to:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine as imposed by the Court in Court File 22CF98 and 22CT67. 
-Comply with all conditions of probation in Minnesota Court File 69DU-CR-21-1431. Violation of any rule of probation, or revocation from probation, constitutes a violation of this condition.
-Defendant has prepaid to the Clerk of Courts the amount of $426.50, which shall be ordered to Victim 1 in 22CM182, and the District Attorney's Office shall provide a restitution order to the Court for that amount.  
-The parties agree, and the defendant understands, that the conditions of any bail or bond in effect on the plea date shall continue for the entire length of this agreement, and that any violation of the defendant's bond may result in bail jumping charges pursuant to Wis. Stat. 946.49. The defendant further understands that a charged violation of the bail or bond for which probable cause is found shall be a basis for the State to vacate this agreement. The parties stipulate to reduce the $1,000 cash bail presently posted in the currently open files 22CF98, 22CT67, and 21CM182 to a $1,000 signature bond and the $1,000 bail may be applied to any outstanding financial obligations. 
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant.

-Undergo an Alcohol and Other Drugs of Abuse (AODA) assessment/evaluation no later than December 31, 2022 and sign a release of information to allow the service provider to communicate with the District Attorney's Office. 
The Defendant, either personally or through his or her attorney, will provide a copy of the AODA evaluation to the District Attorney's Office within thirty (30) days of completion of the evaluation. The Defendant will be truthful with the evaluator and inform the evaluator of the current charge(s) in this case. 
For any recommended conditions contained in the evaluation that are to be completed and/or complied with by the defendant, the defendant, either personally or through his or her attorney, will provide verification of compliance with these conditions no later than 30 days prior to the expiration of this agreement, or upon sooner request of the District Attorney's Office.
If despite good faith efforts made by the defendant, the evaluation or any recommendations therefrom cannot be completed as set forth above in this condition, it is the responsibility of the defendant, either personally or through his or her attorney, to contact the District Attorney's Office at 715-395-1218 to request an extension of the date for completion. The District Attorney's Office has sole discretion whether to agree to modify the date for completion of the evaluation. Failure to request an extension in this circumstance constitutes evidence that the defendant has not made good faith efforts to complete the evaluation or recommendation therefrom as agreed to by the defendant.

-If, at any time during the deferral period, the defendant has no complied with the conditions of this agreement, the State may at its discretion and upon notice the defendant, revoke the agreement and move the Court to enter judgment of conviction and the parties shall proceed to sentencing. At sentencing, the State shall be free to argue for any disposition it deems appropriate, up to and including the maximum sentence provided by law. 
-Except as otherwise provided in this agreement, the State must prove non-compliance with thus agreement by the preponderance of the evidence at a hearing subject to Wis. Stat. 911.01(4)(c). 
-At the end of this deferral period or upon completion of all terms of this agreement, whichever is later, if the defendant has complied with the conditions of this agreement and provided proof of compliance when required, the State will move to amend count 1 to a violation of Wis. Stat. 961.41(3g)(d), misdemeanor possession of amphetamine.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keoni Clark Weiser

records.addlTxt:
11:09 AM Defendant Keoni Clark Weiser in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Keoni Clark Weiser.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CM182, 22CF98, 22CT67, and 22TR1532. Parties recite agreement. Pleas to count 1 and 3 without repeater. Count 2 will be dismissed. Count 1, judgment of conviction will be deferred pursuant to terms of deferred agreement. Count 3, sentence will be 21 days jail with credit for 16 days, time served. Payment of mandatory court costs. In 22CT67, defendant will plead to sole count, sentence of $100 plus costs. 21CM182 will be dismissed but read in. 
Defendant pleads no contest to 22CF98 counts 1 and 3 without repeaters and count 1 in 22CT67. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's pleas and finds that the pleas have been freely, knowingly and voluntarily made. Count 1 in 22CF98, judgment of conviction is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement. 22CF98, count 2 is dismissed. 21CM182, both counts are dismissed but read in. 22TR1532 is dismissed. Court notes that the defendant has prepaid restitution. 
Court orders in 22CF98 on Count 3, sentence of 21 days jail with credit for 16 days, $50 fine plus costs, bail to be applied to fine and surcharge for restitution. In 22CT67, court orders on count 1, sentence of $100 plus costs, bail to be applied to both cases.

10:41 AM Defendant Keoni Clark Weiser in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Keoni Clark Weiser.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CM182, 22CF98, 22CT67, and 22TR1532. Attorney Rosenthal indicates some restitution and fines have been prepaid. Defendant is working to get license reinstated are close to resolution in the files. Asks for another status.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:40 AM Defendant Keoni Clark Weiser in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Keoni Clark Weiser.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes close to resolution and asks for status conference in 45 days. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Keoni Clark Weiser in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Keoni Clark Weiser.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

3:18 PM Defendant Keoni Clark Weiser appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Jaclyn shelton.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified as 2816 Silver Fox Circle, Duluth.  Attorney acknowledges receipt, waives reading, request preliminary hearing. Warrant quashed in 21CM182 based on appearance. Questions non appearance. Attorney indicates had court date in another court, mixed up dates. He is eligible now for public defender.  State requests on $1000 on each file. Cites FTA's on 21CM182. Has open warrants in Minnesota for assaults.  Has FTA in Washington state.  Cites other priors.  Asking for special conditions of no use of drugs or drug paraphernalia. no frequenting bars
In 21CM182, no contact with Victim
Attorney Shelton living at address for a year. Has job interview tomorrow. No money to post. Asks for no more than $300.
Court orders $1,000 in each file. Conditions in 21CM182, no contact with victim 1.  in 22CF98, no use of drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
